storyTypes.name: Monster in the House
storyTypes.description: A closed space and a scary monster create tension. The protagonist's goal is to avoid being eaten.

storyTypes.name: Golden Fleece
storyTypes.description: A journey story where the adventure process is not important, what matters is the protagonist's inner growth and transformation.

storyTypes.name: Wish Fulfillment
storyTypes.description: The protagonist has always been oppressed by those around them and hopes to escape this predicament. But after the wish comes true, they realize that being an ordinary person is the best.

storyTypes.name: Out of the Bottle
storyTypes.description: The protagonist is a troublemaker, but there are some remnants of conscience in them. After a series of events, they finally succeed in changing themselves and achieving growth.

storyTypes.name: Dilemma
storyTypes.description: It's about an ordinary person trapped in a predicament. To get out of the predicament, they must first overcome themselves. The quality of the story depends on the contrast between the predicament and the protagonist.

tips: Maintain consistency in plot and character development
Use rich sensory descriptions to enhance the realism of scenes
Show character personalities and relationships through dialogue and actions
Pay attention to rhythm changes, add climaxes and turning points at appropriate times
Regularly review your story outline to ensure the direction of your story
